content.description: From a sit, climb the beautiful left arete, topout.
content.location: 25 feet above and south of Hidden Treasure (easily seen by looking up), 200 yards north of Subtle Knife.

content.description: Start low and right on good edge, this is a sit start to Reign Of Giants. Hardest Part of the climb is keeping your butt off the rock in the middle of the climb. Here is a beta video if you are so inclined vimeo.com/171149136
content.protection: Few pads will do you good, you cant really pad the start but fortunately be as dabby as it is your never in to much danger.
content.location: From the upper West bluff lot walk along the lake until you come across the first kiosk. Head up and follow the tree line you should run right into this boulder.

content.description: Start in the middle of this large boulder on a set of jugs. Work your way up and left on delicate crimp moves. Top out at the point. There is a possible lower start to this, it might make it slightly harder.
content.location: If looking straight at The Nothing Roof, hike right further into the talus. You will run into Fauxnetics, Reign of Giants is just past this.

content.description: Start with slopey right hand ledge and nice left hand side pull. Work your way up the face. If you use the arete this climb will be easier.
content.location: Down hill from Reign of Giants

content.description: Start matched on the rail jug, traverse out left, top out
content.location: If looking straight at The Nothing Roof keep walking through the talus to the right. You will come across this boulder.

content.description: Reign of Giants is a tooth-like boulder in an open boulder field. The large pedestal behind Reign of Giants is the most prominent landmark in this area. Â Hidden Treasure is low and in the trees just to the north.
